title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist incorrectly selects 'DISPOSED' instead of 'dispose()'
description: Since 'DISPOSED' is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with 'button.DISPOSED' which isn't what I want. I have to delete it all and start again. Code assist should notice that I have typed a '(' and that this matches 'dispose()' better than 'DISPOSED'. Alternatively, code assist should be case sensitive when automatically inserting suggestions.
OB: When using the automatic code assist feature, if I type 'button.' and then select 'DISPOSED' from the list, it inserts 'button.DISPOSED' instead of 'button.dispose()'.
EB: When using the automatic code assist feature, if I type 'button.' and then select 'DISPOSED' from the list, it should insert 'button.dispose()' instead of 'button.DISPOSED'.
SR: 1. Open the code editor. 2. Type 'button.' 3. Invoke the code assist feature. 4. Select 'DISPOSED' from the list. 5. Observe that 'button.DISPOSED' is inserted instead of 'button.dispose()'.
